name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"38eb09f4-6871-4280-b0b7-8d0f41c35e9c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: find_field","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a557a184-a0d3-4a84-aa42-91765e717def","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"find_field","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is a specialized lookup utility used to locate a specific attribute or member (the "field") within a given namespace (the "scopeNs"). It acts as the semantic engine for resolving dotted access, such as ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"object.attribute","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The function is polymorphic, meaning it can handle lookups within built-in Python types (like strings and lists), external definitions, user-defined classes, and general scopes.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"38dcdd6d-5f8a-445d-903b-4b5d6989250f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Attribute access is a fundamental part of Python, but the logic to find an attribute changes depending on what the base object is.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"15f9d6b4-10e4-46cd-b11e-c86ca3a18ce8","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Built-ins:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If you call ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"my_string.upper()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer needs to know that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"upper","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a method belonging to the built-in ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<str>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" type.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"53b0c70e-a09f-47da-b737-7cf2c24d19dd","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Inheritance:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If you access ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"instance.method()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer must check not just the instance's class, but the entire parent hierarchy (MRO).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8d3d87b7-9cc0-48d8-b760-735922d67536","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"External Code:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" For libraries the analyzer hasn't scanned, it must gracefully handle references by assuming the field exists within that external namespace. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"find_field","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" centralizes all these different search strategies into a single interface.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"31940801-63fa-451b-aa30-222c43147d0c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ee124225-f412-429b-a89e-366d54754e7f","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Built-in Type Check:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It first checks if the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"scopeNs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a recognized internal type tag (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<str>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<list>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<map>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"932df916-d2d4-4979-82cc-43bc05344ee6","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If matched, it uses Python's native ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"hasattr","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to verify if the built-in type (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"str","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") actually possesses that field.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"7cb3d711-2dfc-4a95-ba80-ddba1c792f9e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If it exists, it returns a joined namespace (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<str>.upper","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"a0a34330-dc58-4570-a85a-6d8a34fe0a30","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"External Definition Check:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the scope is marked as an external definition (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"EXT_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and no local scope is found, it assumes the field exists and returns the joined namespace (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"requests.get","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1ed88541-c549-458a-8cec-e9e03d6325ed","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Context:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the definition is a Class (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CLS_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), it delegates the search to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"find_cls_fun_ns","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which specifically handles the complex logic of inheritance and Method Resolution Order (MRO).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"166dda9a-6a18-424c-b3c8-bf58791150d0","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Standard Scope Lookup:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If none of the above apply, it performs a direct lookup for the field name within the provided scope's definition list.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c1e8f243-74a4-41c1-9bb0-474ffff4c8e5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Consider the expression ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data.append(x)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a list:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f7e9a1d2-80d3-4936-a129-df84324d92c7","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The analyzer resolves ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the type tag ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<list>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b02ef680-58b4-40dc-b6e5-e08f34369113","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"find_field("<list>", "append")","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is called.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"630bddc1-e18f-4644-8eda-9a936cfd5af3","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It verifies that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"list.append","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" exists in Python.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"69945ed9-be33-4b5c-ba60-aca0b1ee12c7","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<list>.append","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1a745cf1-8bf9-4171-b860-32afe570d992","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now the analyzer knows exactly which method is being called.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"577c41cf-64c9-4ec6-aa63-2dd90e7a0fef","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
